activities.loc: Br I Courtroom, 3rd Fl, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christina L. Peterson

records.addlTxt:
3:06 PM Defendant Christina L. Peterson in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Christina L. Peterson. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF13 & 22TR81 - 22TR85. Magallones states there will be a resolution - Defendant wants to complete treatment before plea & sentencing. Bond continued. adj. 03:08 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

2:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christina L. Peterson in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Christina L. Peterson. Calling 22CF13 & 22TR81 - 22TR85. Magallones states offer has not been excepted - would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 02:37 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christina L. Peterson in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Christina L. Peterson. Calling 22CF13, 22TR81 - 22TR85. Magallones states has received offer - believes cases will resolve - would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 03:21 PM

9:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Christina L. Peterson appeared in court, Attorney Breanna Magallones for Christina L. Peterson appeared in court. Calling 22CF13 & 22TR81 - 22TR85. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Pfeifer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 10:03 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
